00026| async function retryWithBackoff<T>(
00027|   fn: () => Promise<T>,
00028|   maxRetries: number = 3,
00029|   baseDelay: number = 1000
00030| ): Promise<T> {
00031|   let lastError: Error | undefined
00032| 
00033|   for (let attempt = 0; attempt <= maxRetries; attempt++) {
00034|     try {
00035|       return await fn()
00036|     } catch (error: any) {
00037|       lastError = error
00038|       
00039|       // Don't retry on client errors (400-499) or abort errors
00040|       if (error.response?.status >= 400 && error.response?.status < 500) {
00041|         throw error
00042|       }
00043|       if (error.name === 'AbortError') {
00044|         throw error
00045|       }
00046|       
00047|       // Don't retry on last attempt
00048|       if (attempt === maxRetries) {
00049|         break
00050|       }
00051|       
00052|       // Only retry on 5xx errors or network failures
00053|       if (error.response?.status >= 500 || error.code === 'NETWORK_ERROR' || error.code === 'ECONNABORTED') {
00054|         const delay = baseDelay * Math.pow(2, attempt)
00055|         await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, delay))
00056|         continue
00057|       }
00058|       
00059|       // Don't retry on other errors
00060|       throw error
00061|     }
00062|   }
00063|   
00064|   throw lastError || new Error('Retry attempts exhausted')

00067| export function useTextProcessing() {
